adr_address: 2 Bd Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Refined lodging featuring conservative rooms with free Wi-Fi, plus a lobby lounge.

name: The Originals City, Hôtel Paix République, Paris

reviews.text: Rooms are clean, our windows open which is great as I love fresh air at night. The shower is a standing shower, the only thing I do not enough is the rough toilet paper. Many restaurants, cafes, shops, a square right across the street where there’s activities at night such as dancing. The metro is literally right in front of our hotel which is awesome we have enjoyed this service. The hotel is great for couples it’s small and quaint. They have a washroom and sitting area on the main floor. Staff are very friendly which is great! Superb so far!

Stayed for the entire week of my trip to Paris with my mother. Very nice and wonderful staff, workers could speak English to us which made it very easier to communicate in a foreign country. Breakfast was good (located at the bottom floor), very nice and clean room. Right beside many restaurants, fast food places, pharmacies and grocery stores. Quick 20-30 min walk to Norte Dame. Enjoyed our stay and would stay again if we return for another visit.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and we appreciated being able to check in early. The room was small but had old-time charm and included everything we needed. The location is very convenient, with a metro station right outside the hotel. I would definitely stay here again next time.

Lovely stay. Very convenient locations with many metro lines right outside of the hotel and plenty of shops and restaurants in the area.

The room was ok. Very old fashioned. The bathroom was clean on the surface but the toilet was stained. Toilet paper was the cheapest roughest kind and we had to buy our own. The toiletries provided were tiny so we were lucky we brough out own. There was an issue with our mini bar and the AC. The mini bar was leaking water on the inside and soaked all our food we put in there. Once reported, we were told it got cleaned but didn't seem to make any difference. After second mention, the issue got sorted on the second day. The AC wouldn't go below 24°C which was still a bit too hot for us and kept switching itself off. Had to get up 2-3 times during the night to turn in back on. After many back and forth the switching off issue got sorted for the last night but it still wouldn't go lower than 24°C.

We used the hotel breakfast once. Non offensive continental buffet. Nothing extra with not many options for cheeses/meats. At check out, were were informed the one breakfast we had was complimentary. Whether this is the standard or to compensate for the room issues, I don't know. But it was greatly appreciated.

The staff were all very friendly and lovely. And they seemed to genuinely try and help with the AC thing.

Overall, we were satisfied with our stay but would probably go for a bit more modern hotel in the same area if we were to return to Paris.

Very impressed by this hotel and the staff. Very helpful, even arranging a taxi for me in the morning to get to the airport. Beautiful view of the Republique Square and close to the metro. Nice to stay here in a less touristy area, close to the Marais!
